Description: Up for sale is my very rare (2000/2001) Ibanez JCRG-5VV J Custom made at the FujiGen factory in Japan. It features a mahogany body with a AAA flame maple top, a 5-piece maple and bubinga neck, and a jumbo 24-fret ebony fretboard with flamed maple binding and abalone Tree of Life inlays. The fretwork on this guitar is second to none. It has amazing hand-filed and polished rounded fret ends and the ebony fretboard is perfect. You don't see many J Customs with ebony boards (they are usually rosewood). The electronics have been upgraded to DiMarzio Gravity Storm humbuckers and a Blue Velvet single-coil with a 5-way switch. The stock cosmo gold Lo-Pro Edge double locking tremolo and volume/tone knobs have aged nicely. Comes with an Ibanez Prestige hard molded case (in my opinion, the best guitar cases in the business), Ibanez tool, and tremolo arm. The only issues are two small nicks on the back bottom edge that are not visible unless you're looking for them, a small hairline crack in the finish at the upper neck joint, and a very small mark on the back of the headstock (see pics). There is very little fret wear (a few small indentations on the first couple of frets) with lots of life left. I am being hyper-critical here because this guitar is in beautiful condition, especially for its age. It has been given the white glove treatment while in my possession (8 years). I took a lot of pictures so be sure to look at all of them and please ask if you have any questions! I have 100% positive feedback so feel confident that I will pack well and ship fast. I will only ship to the lower US states. If you have zero feedback, please contact me before bidding. Immediate payment required. If you are not prepared to pay immediately, please do not buy it!Thanks for looking!
Title: Ibanez J Custom JCRG-5VV Ebony Fretboard Flame Maple Binding DiMarzio Pickups
